title: Ultimate Ironman Guide/Agility

properties.name: description
properties.value: Agility training on an Ultimate Ironman is similar to training it on a regular account. As a skill, Agility is very useful to train for unlocking shortcuts and improving run energy restoration. It also has the potential for money-making through the Agility Pyramid at lower levels, and looting the coffins in the Hallowed Sepulchre at higher. Agility also provides access to the graceful outfit, the ring of endurance, and stamina potions.

content:
UIM Guide

Agility training on an Ultimate Ironman is similar to training it on a regular account. As a skill, Agility is very useful to train for unlocking shortcuts and improving run energy restoration. It also has the potential for money-making through the Agility Pyramid at lower levels, and looting the coffins in the Hallowed Sepulchre at higher. Agility also provides access to the graceful outfit, the ring of endurance, and stamina potions.

Contents

  • 1 Starting off
    • 1.1 Levels 1–32: Quests
    • 1.2 Levels 1–10: Gnome Stronghold Agility Course
    • 1.3 Passive training: Barbarian Fishing
  • 2 Levels 10–52/99: Rooftop Agility Courses
  • 3 Levels 52–99: Hallowed Sepulchre
  • 4 Other
    • 4.1 Levels 75–99: Prifddinas Agility Course

Starting off[edit | edit source]

Levels 1–32: Quests[edit | edit source]

Early levels can be skipped by completing quests that give Agility experience. Completing the following three quests gives enough experience to get level 32 Agility, at which point training can be started at the Varrock Rooftop Course.

  • Recruitment Drive - requires 12 , Druidic Ritual, Black Knights' Fortress, rewards 1,000xp
  • Tourist Trap - requires 10 , 20 , rewards 9,300xp
  • The Grand Tree - requires 25 , rewards 7,900xp

Levels 1–10: Gnome Stronghold Agility Course[edit | edit source]

If questing is not an option, the Gnome Stronghold Agility Course is the only good training option from level 1 to 10.

Passive training: Barbarian Fishing[edit | edit source]

Main article: Barbarian Training § Barbarian Fishing

Training Fishing with Barbarian Fishing gives small amounts of passive Agility and Strength experience. For every 100,000 Fishing experience gained through Barbarian Fishing, the player should expect about 9,000 Agility experience as well. This means that if the player trains Fishing to level 99 exclusively through Barbarian Fishing, they would get to at least 74 Agility.

For more information, see Ultimate Ironman Guide/Fishing.

Levels 10–52/99: Rooftop Agility Courses[edit | edit source]

Main article: Agility training
A player training on the Seers' Village Rooftop Course.

Rooftop Agility Courses can be used from level 10 onwards. Training on these courses requires no inventory space or resources, and it can be done in almost any gear. The courses also provide marks of grace, which can be used to purchase the graceful outfit, and amylase crystals for stamina potions.

It should be noted that the Seers' Village Rooftop Course is faster xp/hr than both the Pollnivneach Rooftop Course and Rellekka Rooftop Course, if using Camelot Teleport to teleport to the Seers' Village bank with completion of the Hard Kandarin Diary.

Players who do not need marks of grace are advised to train at the Hallowed Sepulchre from level 52 onwards. The Hallowed Sepulchre offers faster experience, and it is also very profitable at higher levels. However, the Rooftop courses remain as a good low-effort alternative past level 52. They are also well-suited for Farming training due to the lack of inventory requirements, as Farming training often fills the inventory with plenty of seeds and produce.

For more information, see Ultimate Ironman Guide/Farming.

Levels 52–99: Hallowed Sepulchre[edit | edit source]

Main article: Hallowed Sepulchre

The Hallowed Sepulchre offers the fastest experience from level 52 onwards. It can also be very profitable at higher levels. However, this method requires good concentration and timing, and some preparation to do effectively. To access the Hallowed Sepulchre, players must have completed Sins of the Father.

With good performance, players can gain up to around 62,000 experience per hour at level 72, increasing to around 69,000 experience per hour at level 82 and 85,000 experience per hour at level 92. Below level 72, players can gain up to 39,000 experience per hour at level 52 and 52,000 experience per hour at level 62.

Other[edit | edit source]

Levels 75–99: Prifddinas Agility Course[edit | edit source]

A player training on the Prifddinas Agility Course.

The Prifddinas Agility Course offers a less click-intensive training option from level 75 onwards. Players must have completed Song of the Elves to access this course. Instead of marks of grace, players can find crystal shards by using portals that randomly appear around the course, which act as shortcuts. These portal shortcuts are unique to each player, and grant the player a crystal shard roughly 1/3 of the time.

Players can gain up to around 59,000 experience per hour at level 75, increasing to around 66,000 experience per hour from level 90 onwards. Players can also expect to find roughly 12 crystal shards per hour.

rawContent:
{{UIM Guide Links}}
[[File:Agility.png|left]]
[[Agility]] training on an Ultimate Ironman is similar to training it on a regular account. As a skill, Agility is very useful to train for unlocking [[shortcuts]] and improving [[run energy]] restoration. It also has the potential for money-making through the [[Agility Pyramid]] at lower levels, and looting the [[Coffin (Hallowed Sepulchre)|coffins]] in the [[Hallowed Sepulchre]] at higher. Agility also provides access to the [[graceful outfit]], the [[ring of endurance]], and [[stamina potion]]s.

==Starting off==
===Levels 1–32: Quests===
Early levels can be skipped by completing quests that give Agility experience. Completing the following three quests gives enough experience to get level 32 Agility, at which point training can be started at the [[Varrock Rooftop Course]].
*[[Recruitment Drive]] - requires {{SCP|Quest|12}}, [[Druidic Ritual]], [[Black Knights' Fortress]], rewards '''1,000xp'''
*[[Tourist Trap]] - requires {{SCP|Fletching|10}}, {{SCP|Smithing|20}}, rewards '''9,300xp'''
*[[The Grand Tree]] - requires {{SCP|Agility|25}}, rewards '''7,900xp'''

===Levels 1–10: Gnome Stronghold Agility Course===
If questing is not an option, the [[Gnome Stronghold Agility Course]] is the only good training option from level 1 to 10.

===Passive training: Barbarian Fishing===
{{Main|Barbarian Training#Barbarian Fishing}}
Training [[Fishing]] with [[Barbarian Training#Barbarian Fishing|Barbarian Fishing]] gives small amounts of passive Agility and [[Strength]] experience. For every 100,000 Fishing experience gained through Barbarian Fishing, the player should expect about 9,000 Agility experience as well. This means that if the player trains Fishing to level 99 exclusively through Barbarian Fishing, they would get to at least 74 Agility.

''For more information, see [[Ultimate Ironman Guide/Fishing]].''

==Levels 10–52/99: Rooftop Agility Courses==
{{Main|Agility training}}
[[File:Seers' Village Rooftop Course (5).png|right|thumb|250px|A player training on the Seers' Village Rooftop Course.]]
[[Rooftop Agility Courses]] can be used from level 10 onwards. Training on these courses requires no inventory space or resources, and it can be done in almost any gear. The courses also provide [[Mark of grace|marks of grace]], which can be used to purchase the [[graceful outfit]], and [[amylase crystal]]s for [[stamina potion]]s.

It should be noted that the [[Seers' Village Rooftop Course]] is faster xp/hr than both the [[Pollnivneach Rooftop Course]] and [[Rellekka Rooftop Course]], if using [[Camelot Teleport]] to teleport to the [[Seers' Village]] bank with completion of the Hard [[Kandarin Diary]].

Players who do not need marks of grace are advised to train at the Hallowed Sepulchre from level 52 onwards. The Hallowed Sepulchre offers faster experience, and it is also very profitable at higher levels. However, the Rooftop courses remain as a good low-effort alternative past level 52. They are also well-suited for Farming training due to the lack of inventory requirements, as Farming training often fills the inventory with plenty of seeds and produce.

''For more information, see [[Ultimate Ironman Guide/Farming]].''

==Levels 52–99: Hallowed Sepulchre==
{{main|Hallowed Sepulchre}}
The [[Hallowed Sepulchre]] offers the fastest experience from level 52 onwards. It can also be very profitable at higher levels. However, this method requires good concentration and timing, and some preparation to do effectively. To access the Hallowed Sepulchre, players must have completed [[Sins of the Father]].

With good performance, players can gain up to around 62,000 experience per hour at level 72, increasing to around 69,000 experience per hour at level 82 and 85,000 experience per hour at level 92. Below level 72, players can gain up to 39,000 experience per hour at level 52 and 52,000 experience per hour at level 62.

==Other==
===Levels 75–99: Prifddinas Agility Course===
[[File:Prifddinas Agility Course (2).png|right|thumb|250px|A player training on the Prifddinas Agility Course.]]
The [[Prifddinas Agility Course]] offers a less click-intensive training option from level 75 onwards. Players must have completed [[Song of the Elves]] to access this course. Instead of marks of grace, players can find [[crystal shard]]s by using portals that randomly appear around the course, which act as shortcuts. These portal shortcuts are unique to each player, and grant the player a crystal shard roughly 1/3 of the time.

Players can gain up to around 59,000 experience per hour at level 75, increasing to around 66,000 experience per hour from level 90 onwards. Players can also expect to find roughly 12 crystal shards per hour.
